ZytKfjVzb5ez8fBoQRf3jg.text: We have visited this location several times, and have been pleased every time. Last night, I had a problem with my dinner. The waitress quickly took to the kitchen to have a new dish started for me. In less than 3 minutes, the manager was at our table. He apologized for the problem, took the dinner off of our bill, and even gave us a gift card towards our next visit!  Everyone at this restaurant is kind and attentive. It's one of our favorite places to dine. Our dinners are consistent, as well as our favorite drink, the long island lemoncello. Delicious every time!

xV6YSqjN2cx8xAXadpSb1g.text: Ordered to go from here. When we got home and unpacked everything I noticed we were missing some items. I immediately called the restaurant. The girl who answered the phone right away said that she knew about the missing items and would get a manager to speak with me. After being on hold for 10 minutes I hung up rather frustrated. A few minutes later manager, Michael did call me back though. ( had my info from the order)  He apologized and offered a $20 gift card to make up for the mistake. This was to be sent via email that night or the next day.  Feeling a little better about the situation after speaking with Michael we began eating.  Kids noodles with meat sauce on the side- a very large portion of noodles and a teeny teeny tiny cup of sauce. :(. Side of extra large brown broccoli. I tried a veggie noodle dish. No taste whatsoever. We also had chicken Alfredo. That was ok. Nothing special. Salads were brown and full of those huge hard lettuce ends. They were thrown right out. That's such a shame because I love the salads. I guess... at least the breadsticks were good?

R5QjYwmOYUyq_vEupPC2GQ.text: My friend and I eat at Olive Garden frequently and we have never had better service! Brian U was our server. He was great!

RT6rrF_Kr_U4k59-S-xQUA.text: Not very good stuffed manicotti. Sausage taste like something from a frozen pizza and there were only about 6 of them. Smothered in meat sauce and cheese. For that much money I figure it should be better quality. The salad is always good. I would only go back for soup and salad but there dinners not so much.

v1M6B3Di9fZyVjMGX7Zftw.text: I don't get why people are all over this  place. We know it's not from Italy, we know the ads are a lie and we know this is "Americanized Italian." Like many world travelers, I've been to ltaly once and my parents 3 times, so in my family  comparisons aren't close. You won't be dining on the Piazza Navona so get over it. I have no reservations or naivete I just understand it for what it is and nothing more. They put out an interesting product and feature creative dishes that do hit the spot sometimes. I'm pretty lenient on them but let's not fault the individual restaurants and staff because their corporate hierarchy portrays it as authentic.

ZXz3jYbpqJ4n1QsUdozsQg.text: Im a fan of Olive Garden.  It is super consistent, priced right and the service is always decent.  I have always had a good experience at all of them I have been to.  My preference is to not frequent chain restaurants, I will always opt for something more interesting and inventive but........ I have a motto..... "when in doubt choose the Olive Garden"  I love the changes to the menu with lighter fare and more interesting combinations.

ROppg5tGB3DvZOwRXS4HFg.text: All you can eat soup, salad and breadsticks? Yes please!   I went here on a Thursday afternoon with my roommate and we had a pleasant experience. The waiter was attentive and re-filled our bowls when we needed them and brought us plenty of salad and breadsticks. We were pleased!

-36QiaUG7j8knj-za5W1Iw.text: "Italian Kitchen"..... Um not quite! There are so many real Italian restaurants in the area that blow OG away! Everything is so bland, over-salted, and well.... Just not good! Prices seem so high for the quality of food. I'm always stuck going here for birthday dinners and no one ever seems so impressed! The wedding soup should be ashamed of itself!!!! Servers are always nice, but there are other local/ independent places that actually serve Italian food!

_Gig-DvH1rW4bo5gvUidhg.text: Like any other OG. Long wait for pasta I can cook better at home. I do like their steak Gorgonzola balsamic reduction. (don't try making at home) YUCK. Decent service usually high school kids. Often fast decent service will fix issues if any arise. Nothing overly nice or bad to say.

ezAdW2GwxkIfySBDtr7cjw.text: Great location! Always helpful. Saw a manager take a lot of yelling from a large party that didn't understand that their size effected wait time. She took it in stride, but there was no making them happy. Her swift handling of this loud group kept the situation under control and maintained the quality of our experience!

B6-pQh-L5h5aSjP7IOV_lw.text: This og lounge is ehh. Generally we get good service. One time tho I had visited for lunch with my girlfriend (now fiance). We were dressed casual and we are in our early 20s. Not sure if that gave the staff the impression that we don't deserve good service. Anyways we were sat in the back connor near the emergency exit. Dirty table and dirty chairs were stacked behind us. Also the table was so small we wouldn't have been able to eat comfortably. After sitting for five minutes I said f this and got up and we chose our own both. The waiter didn't apologize and the rest of our service was upsetting.

NgfPqO8TX23eLoFv1QIC-w.text: This is a decent Olive Garden location in the Mills. We had the seafood brodetto and shrimp primavera, along with some house wine, and were satisfied with the taste and quality of the food. The minestrone soup was also good.   The main downside for us was that the waiters were cleaning up other tables while we were eating and the cleaning liquid had a not-so-good odor.   The interior is pretty much similar to other Olive Gardens I have been to. Decent, but chainy looking. Where we sat was somewhat dark, which could be good or bad. We considered it romantic -- if not for the odor of the cleaning liquid.   If you feel like eating at a chain (which is likely your unavoidable fate while you are at the Mills) , this may not be a bad choice. Tell them beforehand not to clean up with odorous liquids, however!

4H6DfqydMrPESjDdBr3JMQ.text: I've been dining at Olive Garden for years always the one in Monroeville, but decided to go to Pittsburgh Mills this time around, not the right choice. My fiance and I haven't had OG in a long time, so since it was Valentine's Day weekend we said hey why not OG. Shocked that it was not a packed house since it was Valentine's Day, but we did go late around 9pm. No wait at all! They was offering a sip of some white wine, we said sure we're try it out. My fiance looked at his glass and it was dirty, so our waiter went to get him another dirty glass. My glass was dirty as well. The silverware and plates was not cleaned well too. We ordered an app, the stuffed mushrooms (very very good) my fiance ordered the wedding soup (he felt it was not enough meatballs) he had the tour of Italy (the lobster in the pasta was so tiny, it was like a gain of rice, OG needs to be a shame to serve those small pieces of lobster to their customers). I had salad (not enough dressing) and I ordered something new since I always get the chicken parm, shrimp Carbonara it was good excepted they left the tail of the shrimp shell on the shrimp. I like to eat my pasta without stopping to take off the tail first. I was shocked and disappointed that they got rid of the raspberry cheesecake. This was not my best experience at all at OG. I think I will continue to go to Monroeville. The waiter I forgot his name, but he was sweet, nice, and polite.

q_mKmCeHzJx7hjQTT5FA-Q.text: My endless soup (and salad) took 45 minutes to come to my table at lunchtime!  The waitress was unconcerned about taking care of our table of 4 and instead was more concerned with the table of 15 guys she told us about.  We had to keep asking for our food and repeating our orders!  We thought we ordered the fastest and easiest thing (salad and soup), but this was quite a disappointment.  We were celebrating our friend's birthday and our server never even suggested or offered any dessert or made her feel special in any way!  I would not go here for another birthday celebration.  I have never left such a small tip before in recent memory (10% only).  We had the money and were a mature (not elderly) group, but felt the waitress judged us as less important than the big group she was also waiting on.  Very unimpressive.

80-CYAy3WUGxc8KYqSmLXg.text: Terrible experience!!!  Service was extremely slow.  Music blasting in background.  Screaming kids in all directions.  Manager was more concerned with getting more take-out orders than addressing these issues!  Never will return to this location.  Cranberry location much quieter and service is exceptional there.

HVV_k702_bcWqHwxeUaGSA.text: Unlimited soup and salad followed by delicious chicken Alfredo (I sent compliments to the chef for this) and amazing tiramisu !!! and love the friendly staff ....

McLTh4m4e-t4XgMDQyZQzg.text: The saving grace for this place is the portions. You get a whole lot of food if you order any pasta dish, and unlimited salad and breadsticks. The food isn't all that good though. The sauce is bland. Soups are good. Salad is mad crunchy! Service is what you would expect from a huge chain company, hit and miss. Usually good though.

I0Ahe9NNHy0CsOyz9ESVzA.text: Excellent as always!! Had one of their new dishes... Mediterranean Chicken (feta cheese, basil, olives, spinach, tomatoes...over pasta..).   It was awesome!! Service was great too.

reir8osxttQU52pWb2qlMg.text: I mean- it's Olive Garden...so the food as about as authentic as breasts at a gentleman's club...  It's cheap, plentiful and not awful... (I'm a sucker for their soup and salad.)  The servers at this location are excellent..polite and attentive . Also, the restaurant is very clean.  If you're in the mood for a chain restaurant and at the Mills, you can't go wrong.

wjhQS-Bvbw8rFhAwIdqKpQ.text: I think the best deal is the $9.99 build your pasta and all you can eat salad. I really like the salad because it's healthy and it's all I can eat most of the time I take the pasta home. The atmosphere and decor is really nice and most of the time service is fast and efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive Garden Italian Restaurant - Tarentum, PA, United States. Our Famous House Salad
Photo of Olive Garden Italian Restaurant - Tarentum, PA, United States. Our Famous House Salad
Photo of Olive Garden Italian Restaurant - Tarentum, PA, United States. Love the salad

KlUrn8NDRGAsZ98SOGPgtA.text: First, I was impressed with the handwashing signs in the bathroom.  Double washing is a great idea ... and we are in flu season.  We (3 adults & 3 kids) were seated in a large comfortable booth.  The breadsticks with a vat of alfredo were a hit.  One serving of the fried cheese served all of us.  The picky eaters were able to tailor their meals.  I would have preferred spring greens to head lettuce in the salad.  The children enjoyed their pizzas. Two of the adult meals were the sirlion.  The meals were cooked to preferences.  I had the shrimp scampi. The noodles reminded me of ramen.  The dining room was empty when we arrived.  A family of 3 were seated in the 6 person booth behind us.  The infant had ear-piercing screams from the front door, through the meal, and out the door.  It doesn't reflect on the restaurant but definitely decreased our enjoyment of the meal.  BEWARE:  There is a "gameboy" on the table with a credit card slot.  The children decided to pass it around.  I received a video game charge ($2).  At no time did the "gameboy" ask for my credit card to start use.  The waitress explained once a game is opened charge automatically appears.  I thought that was sneaky.    This restaurant was a convenient meal option but not a future "let's go to ..." option.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive Garden Italian Restaurant - Tarentum, PA, United States. I like this policy.

LGFhnXxWAu2JXHtC7cqPPA.text: Dear Olive Garden, I'm not coming to your restaurant to just pay for the food on my plate, I'm also coming for the experience. The food is great. Why is the experience a nightmare?   The food was delicious and the staff was friendly. My only complaint is that the seating wasn't particularly thoughtful. For example, younger couples were seated next to extremely noisy families with screaming babies, older couples were seated in dark areas and couldn't see their menus, and younger rowdier teens were seated near middle aged adult couples wanting to enjoy a quiet evening nowhere near teenagers. It was a bit chaotic to say the least. My husband and I were practically seated in the kitchen and were subjected to wait staff chatter throughout our meal. Also, for most of our meal, we were literally yelling at each other over the noise and unable to enjoy a simple conversation. I don't understand why multiple babies are allowed to scream for 20 minutes or more and the staff never ask the parent to handle the situation. A toddler was throwing food and nobody said anything.   If I'm getting a fast food experience, why am I paying for a restaurant experience? The food is always so good, but we end up leaving very prematurely with to-go bags because it's difficult to stomach your meal under so much stress.

SwHV1uV1LzrdYr24kV8SAw.text: We love Olive Garden.   Salad is the best always fresh and cold.   I had the wine they featured it was a moscato good taste.   My soup was the bean soup not my favorite.   Hubby had lobster mac and cheese it was very good. No wait to be seated at 3:00 pm.

1L2nWrs1s_p3ijVSDZyJ3Q.text: A great little Olive Garden. Yes, it's a chain restaurant, but it's an Olive Garden I've had a lot of good experiences at for many years, since it opened, really.  I've always had good service, the food always seems as fresh as Olive Garden food is going to be, and it always seems clean, even when it is really busy, which it does get busy.  At any Olive Garden, my go to is the eggplant parmesan or the soup and salad (unlimited) special for lunch.   I really can't think of much else to say- it is an Olive Garden. Expect typical Italian food at a chain restaurant and really, really great breadsticks!

6nEDvaKcf2kufacZNQX6Ew.text: I really used to like Olive Garden.  I'm not sure if I've just become more of a food snob or if the quality has taken a nose dive.  I miss the regular chicken Marsala.    Last time I got a pasta with garlic sauce and it was horrible.  I can't expect too much for a chain restaurant but for the price, the quality is horrible.  Probably won't waste money there anymore.  This is not a reflection on this particular Olive Garden but just the company itself.

3PxL5HUjGSixVE8SxR5ZWw.text: I know that Olive Garden gets a hard time for not being authentic Italian but that's ok with me. I love their soups and Pittsburgh is the only region that still has the wedding soup and that's my favorite. The "Creat Your Own Pasta" is my standard go to. I like the flexibility and most importantly the price. I also really like the new pesto sauce they offer. It's much lighter than the other sauce I get.   All in all, Olive Garden is still a winner in my book for decent, quick food.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive Garden Italian Restaurant - Tarentum, PA, United States. Dark chocolate caramel cream

8lj3chvTFGkAHmSQ6blJ1g.text: Last night I ate dinner at the Olive Garden in the Pittsburgh Mills Mall, Tarentum PA. I only ate about half of my eggplant parmigiana entree, and asked for the rest to be boxed. Just now, I put my leftovers onto a plate to heat them up for lunch, and a large piece of solid metal tumbled out from underneath my leftover eggplant parm and onto my plate (pictures attached). Luckily I saw it before I took a bite, but it was large, solid, and undoubtedly would have broken a tooth or been a choking hazard.   Just wanted to let your restaurant know that you are likely missing a chunk of some sort of kitchen equipment, and I have it!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive Garden Italian Restaurant - Tarentum, PA, United States. Close-up of metal piece found in food...it is about 1/4 inch in diameter, and solid metal.
Photo of Olive Garden Italian Restaurant - Tarentum, PA, United States. Close-up of the metal piece that ended up in my leftover eggplant parmigiana.
Photo of Olive Garden Italian Restaurant - Tarentum, PA, United States. A large piece of metal something that rolled out with my leftover eggplant parmigiana.

ambnWf28uTzWvNs3KoW8Yg.text: I know it's Olive Garden and it's big box, but the food is great for the price. Our server, Taylor, was attentive and prompt. The watermelon sangria was absolutely fantastic!

photos.caption: Photo of Olive Garden Italian Restaurant - Tarentum, PA, United States. The watermelon sangria was absolutely fantastic! Very light and refreshing!

zLMU8yyHcV8Sn98071es_g.text: I went here a few weeks ago on a Saturday with my family. It was terrible. The food was lukewarm , breadsticks were salty, server kept forgetting things. I would not go back.  Nothing more unappealing than cold Alfredo sauce. The other thing is the food was just hurled on the plate. Honestly go to the store and make your own Italian dinner.

SleVdZetuMTy8xblNqN1mA.text: Stinky.  You're greeted with a dank smell when you walk in the door.  Like an old mop head or bar towel that's been festering in a bucket of old  water.   We looked at each and decided to give it try, hoping it doesn't stink in the seating area.   It did.  It was horrible.   Look, I know its industrial grade Italian and wasn't expecting anything spectacular, however, cleanliness is important to me.      Once the server arrived we decided to leave, we explained to her that it was horrible stinky and she said we get that all the time!   She blamed it on the cheese that gets dropped on he floor! .   We split, heading out the door and the hostess asked what's up and we explained and she said she'll let the manager know.  Oh yeah, last thing, this smell reminded us of Houlihans in the mills when it was open.  You were greeted with the same stank dank smell.  Not going back.

DUcSV-OWSSv1V9D-VlaiAQ.text: Love Italian Garden !!!!!  Very clean restaurant, nice employees, we love their salad & our lunches & dinner's are always delicious !!

1OGNh1cpsCLVftZAzAH63A.text: This is so sub standard anymore! The saute dishes always lack flavor and never have any sauce to them! You surely lack culinary professionals and skills Olive Gardens! My recent visit was the Chicken and Shrimp Scampi(upcharge to do it was fine) but here it came out with asparagus and red onion in it and no fresh herbs, nor any dry herbs, and no sauce. I  could taste no wine, garlic, lemon, or butter! My wife had Chicken Parm with Fettuccini Alfredo, again, hardly any sauce to no sauce! The bread sticks have got to go. These were so salty that not even the wildlife would eat them. Its a wonder how this chain cant get their head out of their ass and do better! Try any other Italian restaurants unless you like sub standard food.

XYjvntaJ3BE8HfGZjNtTTw.text: I like Olive Garden for the endless salad and breadsticks and nothing more. I'll never understand the mad rush and long waits for overpriced basic pasta dishes. It's insane.

FShy8XoGjAhXOeAWuG_x0g.text: Had chicken ravioli appatizer, was horrible. I complained, they didn't care. I ordered soup and salad no onion. It was full of onion. The waitress acted like it came out of her personal check when I ordered a second bowl of "all you can eat" soup. When I ordered a third I thought i was going to have to get it myself! Soup was good though.

photos.caption: Photo of Olive Garden Italian Restaurant - Tarentum, PA, United States. Don&#39;t come to this one.

KBBezrsmGYCKMEqQyP2Scg.text: Endless Soup and Salad.  This is a no risk lunch meal.  OG has a standard and they follow it faithfully.  Yes, it's cookie cutter in every way, but the soups are all very tasty and the salad is always as expected:  fresh and ready to go with their signature house dressing.  So when you are not on an epicurean adventure and you really need to count on quick service and a fast and enjoyable lunch - hit the OG for endless soup and salad.  It will be exactly what you expect and nothing more.

sdQvCkMbyEqYo4tTltcvyw.text: We walked in and walked out. This restaurant smells rotten when you enter. The moldy smell gets worse in the seating area. We left before we ordered. The waiter confirmed that the rotten moldy smell was normal. Yuck.

7orUVl57Ht5nwnnzJTu9Gw.text: Walked in, was seated, then walked out.   1) Dining room is so loud, it's roaring. 2) It's too crowded and cramped.   What happened?  When did Olive Garden turn into Golden Corral?  Went next door to Longhorn and had a meal with my wife in peace.   To be clear:  I did not try the food or even experience the service. The environment was way too poor to stay.

txjvMe63xqwixPoeqjv1UQ.text: Good quality has gone down significantly.  Use to be kind of my favorite restaurants and now it's one of my least favorite.  The food even tastes different.
